materials.raw_text: B: 1.2 g, Co: 0.6 g, Fe: 0.5 g, Nd: 0.3 g, Tm: 0.2 g (Total: 2.8 g; adjust proportions accordingly for larger volume)

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores; Co (Cobalt powder) - Metal suppliers; Fe (Iron powder) - Metal suppliers; Nd (Neodymium powder) - Rare earth suppliers; Tm (Thulium powder) - Rare earth suppliers.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores; Co (Cobalt powder) - Metal suppliers; Fe (Iron powder) - Metal suppliers; Nd (Neodymium powder) - Rare earth suppliers; Tm (Thulium powder) - Rare earth suppliers.

1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, add B, Co, Fe, Nd, and Tm in the specified order. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to ensure uniform distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, add B, Co, Fe, Nd, and Tm in the specified order. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to ensure uniform distribution.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1200°C for 1 hour to promote sintering. 3. Ensure a controlled atmosphere to prevent oxidation, possibly using argon gas.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1200°C for 1 hour to promote sintering. 3. Ensure a controlled atmosphere to prevent oxidation, possibly using argon gas.

steps: 1. After heating, allow the crucible to cool gradually inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 2 hours). 2. Avoid abrupt cooling to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, allow the crucible to cool gradually inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 2 hours). 2. Avoid abrupt cooling to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. If necessary, grind the edges to achieve desired dimensions. 3. Clean the surface with isopropyl alcohol to remove any residues. 4. Optionally, seal the material using an appropriate resin to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. If necessary, grind the edges to achieve desired dimensions. 3. Clean the surface with isopropyl alcohol to remove any residues. 4. Optionally, seal the material using an appropriate resin to enhance durability.
